alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 30 at 2:02PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall and poor drainage is possible. * WHERE...Guam. * WHEN...Through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Compromised trees could fall with further soil saturation. Slides are possible with excessive runoff in steep terrain and cliff areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Saturated soils, clogged drains and debris have been left across the island in the wake of Mawar. More heavy rain late last night and today has increased soil saturation and lead to flooding across the island. A wet pattern with more rounds of heavy showers and thunderstorms is expected through Thursday night. The best potential for flooding looks to be Wednesday night into Thursday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
